title: Sus & Diminished Chords
description: Learn suspended and diminished chords — tension-building chords that add drama to your music.

steps.title: Beyond Major and Minor
steps.description:
Suspended (sus) chords replace the 3rd with another note, creating an 'unresolved' tension:

• Sus4: the 3rd moves up to the 4th
• Sus2: the 3rd moves down to the 2nd

Diminished chords stack two minor 3rds, creating an unstable, tense sound that wants to resolve.

steps.title: Play Csus4
steps.description: Play C, F, G. The sus4 chord feels 'suspended' — it wants to fall back to C major.
steps.hint: C (60) + F (65) + G (67). F replaces E.

steps.title: Resolve to C Major
steps.description: Now play C major (C, E, G). Hear how the tension of sus4 resolves when the F drops down to E.

steps.title: Play Csus2
steps.description: Play C, D, G. The sus2 has an open, airy quality — common in rock and pop.
steps.hint: C (60) + D (62) + G (67). D replaces E.

steps.title: Play B Diminished
steps.description: Play B, D, F — a diminished triad. It sounds tense and unstable, like something dramatic is about to happen.
steps.hint: B (71) + D (74) + F (77). Each interval is a minor 3rd (3 semitones).

steps.title: Resolve Diminished to C
steps.description: Play C major to resolve the tension of B diminished. In the key of C, Bdim naturally leads to C.

steps.title: Sus & Dim Quiz
steps.description: In a sus4 chord, what replaces the 3rd?
